body:
When running cctr tests that call cctr recursively (e.g., tests that run 'cctr $CCTR_FIXTURE_DIR/tests'), the nested invocation uses the installed cctr binary (e.g., ~/.local/bin/cctr), NOT the debug build (./target/debug/cctr).

This causes confusing test failures when developing new features - the outer test uses the new code, but inner tests use the old installed version.

Fix: Run './script/install' to update the installed binary before running tests, or use PATH manipulation to ensure the debug build is found first.
title: cctr: nested tests use installed binary, not debug build
